classes.description: Base parent notice class. This defaults to the system notice style.
Adds the higher importance style by emboldening the background color. These should only be used for pressing information that needs to be noticed by the user.

accessible.description: Defines a live region with advisory information for the user, but not important enough to warrant an alert (Source)

A form of live region which contains important, usually time-sensitive, information. Elements with an alert role have an implicit aria-live value of assertive and implicit aria-atomic value of true. (Source)

Informs assistive technologies, such as screen readers, if they should ignore the element. This should not be confused with the HTML hidden attribute which tells the browser to not display an element. (Source)
Only used if a title is present, it provides assistive technologies with a title for the dialog. (Source)
If aria-labelledby is not used (because no title is present) and role="alert" is in use, this must be used to provides assistive technologies with a title for the dialog. (Source)
Provides assistive technologies with the alert's descriptive copy (Source)
